dialogueLines: That night was quiet and warm, just the two of us on the beige couch.
You brought a blanket — the soft cream one you love so much.
I picked the movie, of course. You always let me choose.
It was a romance film — the one that always makes me cry at the end.
You teased me when I wiped a tear and said, 'Here we go again.'
I made popcorn, maybe a little burnt, but you said it was perfect anyway.
You laughed before the jokes even landed — I loved that about you.
The only light came from the screen; everything else felt far away.
I wore my cozy gray sweater; you said I looked comfortable enough to sleep.
We drank warm tea that night — no coffee, no soda, just tea.
You told me you love romance movies even though you pretend you don’t.
I said sad endings feel more real than happy ones.
The clock ticked slowly — it felt like time stopped for us.
After the movie, you turned to me and said, 'That was perfect.'
I smiled and said, 'Every movie’s perfect when I’m with you.'
Then I whispered, 'Don’t forget this night.'
The soft piano from the end credits filled the room.
You stretched your arms and said you’d make better popcorn next time.
We sat in silence for a while, but it wasn’t awkward — it was peaceful.
Even now, I can still hear the sound of the rain outside that night.

questions.questionText: What kind of movie did we watch?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! A romance — my favorite kind of story.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not horror. It was a love story, remember?

questions.questionText: Who chose the movie?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I chose the movie — you always let me pick.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t pick it, I did.

questions.questionText: What color was the blanket we used?
questions.correctResponse: Right! That soft cream blanket we always used.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t gray, it was cream.

questions.questionText: What was the color of the couch?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! The beige couch — warm and comfortable.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not black, it was beige.

questions.questionText: What snack did I make?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Popcorn — burnt, but still good.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t cookies, it was popcorn.

questions.questionText: What drink did we have that night?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Just tea — no coffee that night.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not coffee. We had tea.

questions.questionText: What was the lighting like in the room?
questions.correctResponse: Right! Only the movie screen lit the room.
questions.wrongResponse: No… there wasn’t any candlelight, only the screen.

questions.questionText: What color sweater was I wearing?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! That gray sweater I love — so cozy.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not blue, it was gray.

questions.questionText: What did I say about sad endings?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said they feel more real than happy ones.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said they feel real, not boring.

questions.questionText: What did I say when you teased me for crying?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said I always cry — it’s who I am.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say nothing, I said I always cry.

questions.questionText: What was the background sound during the credits?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! The soft piano from the end credits.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not silence. The piano played softly.

questions.questionText: What did you say about the popcorn?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! You said it was perfect, even though it was burnt.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t complain. You said it was perfect.

questions.questionText: What did you say after the movie ended?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! You said that was perfect.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t say you’re sleepy, you said it was perfect.

questions.questionText: What did I whisper at the end?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said don’t forget this night.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say goodnight. I said don’t forget.

questions.questionText: What did I call every movie we watched together?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said every movie’s perfect when I’m with you.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said perfect, not funny.

questions.questionText: What emotion filled the night?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Joy — that simple, peaceful happiness.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t sadness.

questions.questionText: What did you promise for next time?
questions.correctResponse: Right! You promised to make better popcorn next time.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t promise snacks, just better popcorn.

questions.questionText: What sound was outside that night?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Rain — it matched the piano perfectly.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t wind. It was rain.

questions.questionText: What did I say about you laughing early?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said I love that about you.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t complain. I said I loved it.

questions.questionText: What did I call that night?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Perfect — that night was everything I needed.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not sad. It was perfect.
